section.title: Introduction
section.para: &app; is a simple GNOME application designed to allow individuals to keep a catalogue of their book collection. In addition, it enables users to keep track of books which are on loan.

listitem.para:
retrieves and displays book information (sometimes with cover pictures) from several online libraries and bookshops, such as
Amazon (searches .co.uk, .fr, .de, .jp and .ca websites, as well as amazon.com)
Proxis
Barnes and Noble
Spanish Ministry of Culture
Thalia
Internet Bookshop Italia
Renaud-Bray
US Library of Congress
British Library
allows books to be added and updated by hand
enables searches either by ISBN, title, authors or keyword
supports the Z39.50 standard and allow you to define your own online book information sources
saves data using the text-based YAML format, making it easy to work with your book data
can import and export data into ONIX, Tellico and ISBN-list formats
can export library data in the form of XHTML web pages themable with CSS
allows marking your books as loaned, each with the loan-date and the name of the person who has borrowed them
shows books in different views (standard list or icons list), that can be filtered and/or sorted
supports CueCat barcode readers for data entry

note.para: Alexandria is under active development (as of December 2007) and new features are being planned and added regularly. See the &app; web page for more information.
